title: Power - R2 greater than R1 and V1 greater than V2

content.question: Resistor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has a greater resistance than Resistor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Resistor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is connected to a <math alttext="6.0 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math> battery and Resistor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is connected to a <math alttext="1.5 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math> battery. Which of the following claims about the power dissipated in the resistors is correct?

choices.label: The power dissipated by Resistor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> must be more than the power dissipated by Resistor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

The power dissipated by Resistor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> must be more than the power dissipated by Resistor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.
The two resistors must dissipate the same amount of power.

The power dissipated by Resistor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> could be either more than, less than, or the same as the power dissipated by Resistor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

content.answer: The power dissipated by Resistor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> must be more than the power dissipated by Resistor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
